intro: Sideroxylon beguei var. longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-pedicellate ironwood, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
